text:
Employees want to grow
and to learn new skills
and the business wants to be adaptable
and as innovative as possible.

Docebo helps those two parts
meet and be on the same side.

Docebo is a learning platform
for employees and customers
that began in 2005.
We were new kids on the block

and not very well
known in the global market.

and not very well
known in the global market.
We were scaling quite slowly.

Because of that, we decided to change
the business model and the approach.
We moved to software as a service in 2012.
We had to

reevaluate and relearn
how to optimize our system.
AWS helped us a lot with
a number of best practices, tutorials,

setting up infrastructure properly,
scaling, and performance, etc.

They care about how you use the solution
and how you can optimize the usage.
We could focus on our product because

we were delegating all the compliance
and infrastructure
to AWS themselves.

It has been also a huge boost
for the morale of this company
because they have access
to world-class thinkers in the SaaS world.
Docebo started with very few AWS services
but then we quickly grew to over 100.

That's because we really see the value
of having a pre-made solution
that we can leverage to innovate faster.
When AWS comes up with a new service,

that's a trigger for me to evolve
our platform and our product.

I've been surprised by how powerful it is
to have AWS
providing all these building blocks

in the shape
that we need for our customer.
We have seen a 56%
We have seen a 56%
reduction of employee turnover,
and up to 70%

improvement in the time
a new employee needs
to become productive.

We had just one
deployment that would serve all of our customers
and that improved our

customer satisfaction
and our end system efficiency.

We now have the freedom
to innovate and grow because AWS
is taking care of lots of problems.
We passed from 200 customers

to the current
4K all around the world.
What's coming next for us and AWS
What's coming next for us and AWS
is keep on learning, keep on growing,
keep on challenging ourselves,
experimenting with new services.

We really believe that generative AI in
our field can change

how we can be
more effective for our customers
and more relevant for our learners.
It's the future of learning.
